channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Damaged bollard, 11th July
item.description:
Bollard has been damaged. Large truck hit it.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queensbridge Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Plants suffering from being treated as litter dumping ground, 11th July
item.description:
Several plants have died due to littering and people sitting on these planters. People put in all manner of litter LHQ cleaner is always cleaning them but today someone has put in traffic sign and planter box has been moved. Very sad. Plants further down are fairing better

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Buckingham Gate, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree dead, loose branches, 11th July
item.description:
Very large tree believed to be dead is in need of pruning, numerous large branches have become loose and at risk of falling on residents walking by
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodlands Road, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown Tree - Pedestrian Bottleneck, 11th July
item.description:
Please ask 35 Amhurst Road to trim their tree back as it is causing a bottleneck amongst pedestrians who are using this walkway whilst works are underway. Itâ€™s difficult to navigate through.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Amhurst Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter getting out of comtrol, 11th July
item.description:
10 Buckingham Gate, opposite Gate C where tourists are queuing. Looks like tourists adding rubiish to to filled commercial waste bags and are putting loose items in top. Spilling in street and road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birdcage Walk, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned car, 11th July
item.description:
Car parked on Bramerton Road for 3 months since early May 2025, not been moved or attended to since. Bith wing mirrors since been damaged. Looks like flat tyres. Bags in the boot and back seat not moved or retrieved.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bramerton Road, Elmers End, London
